title: Persecution of Jews
common: On this page, we highlight instances of persecution against Jewish people examined by History Tracers:

value.name: The Visigoths (Sisebuto):
value.desc: During the reign of Sisebuto, Jewish communities were coerced into converting to Christianity, as documented by Saint Isidore of Seville.

value.name: The Visigoth (Egica):
value.desc: The 16th Council of Toledo, held during Egica's reign, recorded severe and discriminatory measures against Jewish populations.

value.name: The Leme family:
value.desc: Under the reign of Afonso V, Lem Maerten I permitted his Jewish creditors to be subjected to Christian judicial proceedings.

value.name: Understanding Contexts (part II):
value.desc: This study delves into one of history's most abhorrent chapters: the ideological and systemic foundations that enabled Nazism to persecute Jewish people and other groups. Readers are encouraged to review the first part of this series beforehand (History Tracers, , Understanding contexts (part I)).
